issue.title: Hello, and how can I help?
issue.body:
I see your in the beginning phases of this project and there is not much to see, but what I do see I like. This is the most active and current effort to create such a thing on the web so I thought this is where I would like to offer my help. When I first started programming many years ago I dreamed that one day I could create something like this. It seemed like a very far off goal, one I had l had long since forgotten about until recently while getting deep into DSP/Audio programming on the web.

One of my goals is to be able to emulate analog circuits which will produce a signal you can hear and interact with as well as visualize.

Where are you at with this project and where could you use the most input and/or assistance?

issue.title: 0Ω resistors don't work
issue.body:
IMHO they should act like simple wires.

This project looks awesome! Kudos! :D

issue.title: Need to tell users how to create components
issue.body:
Possible implementation:
- If no components have been created
- User selects component type from sidebar
- Moves mouse over canvas
- A message appears in the bottom right saying "Click and drag on the canvas to create a(n) ${typeID}"

issue.title: Build broken
issue.body: Looks like Snap is caching installed NPM modules or something?

issue.title: Components should be editable
issue.body: E.g. resistance for resistor, current for current source.

issue.title: Implement redux logger
issue.body: [Redux logger](https://github.com/fcomb/redux-logger)

issue.title: Need to tell users how to create components
issue.body:
Possible implementation:
- If no components have been created
- User selects component type from sidebar
- Moves mouse over canvas
- A message appears in the bottom right saying "Click and drag on the canvas to create a(n) ${typeID}"

issue.title: Component values should be visible
issue.body: E.g. 5Ω, 1A.

issue.title: New org logo
issue.body: Need a nicely designed org logo, not a crappy screenshot.

issue.title: Disconnected Ground causes noticeable numerical errors
issue.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1884486/10074480/25ab1e68-62c8-11e5-86a0-aec3ab62a8d3.png)

Ground connected:

```
CurrentSource 1
2Resistor.js:83 Resistor 0.9997000999660113
Resistor.js:83 Resistor 0.9996001399520164
Ground.js:110 Ground [0.0003998600479836467]
CurrentSource.js:102 CurrentSource 1
```

Ground disconnected:

```
CurrentSource 1
Resistor.js:83 Resistor 1.0000000000000002
2Resistor.js:83 Resistor 0.9999000099990002
Ground.js:110 Ground [-0]
```

Probably due to the fact that we're connecting disconnected circuits to ground with a high-value resistor. Time to consider #27 more seriously?

issue.title: Sources should indicate current/voltage direction
issue.body:
- [ ] Current Source
- [x] Voltage Source

**Current Source**
Maybe this?
![current source](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b2/Current_Source.svg/2000px-Current_Source.svg.png)

 Or keep the symbol we already have and add an arrowhead to the line, similar to this:
![circuit](http://www.solved-problems.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/Problem-1246-3.png)

issue.title: Re-license
issue.body:
Consider using a more appropriate license.

I want all modifications/derivatives to be open source, should I GPL this?

issue.title: Build broken
issue.body: Looks like Snap is caching installed NPM modules or something?

issue.body: [Redux logger](https://github.com/fcomb/redux-logger)

issue.body: E.g. resistance for resistor, current for current source.

issue.title: Voltage should be visualised
issue.body:
A couple of possibilities:
- colour gradients along wires/components, as in Falstad's sim
- numbers and mini-scopes, as in everycircuit

rename.from: Current source should have arrow indicating current direction

issue.title: Sources should indicate current/voltage direction
issue.body:
- [ ] Current Source
- [x] Voltage Source

**Current Source**
Maybe this?
![current source](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b2/Current_Source.svg/2000px-Current_Source.svg.png)

issue.title: Branding
issue.body:
- [x] favicon etc.
- [x] links to GitHub/website etc.

issue.title: Current dots should be rendered on top
issue.body: Similar to #19, the current dots are sometimes rendered underneath adjacent components.

issue.title: Disconnected Ground causes noticeable numerical errors
issue.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1884486/10074480/25ab1e68-62c8-11e5-86a0-aec3ab62a8d3.png)

Ground connected:

```
CurrentSource 1
2Resistor.js:83 Resistor 0.9997000999660113
Resistor.js:83 Resistor 0.9996001399520164
Ground.js:110 Ground [0.0003998600479836467]
CurrentSource.js:102 CurrentSource 1
```

Ground disconnected:

```
CurrentSource 1
Resistor.js:83 Resistor 1.0000000000000002
2Resistor.js:83 Resistor 0.9999000099990002
Ground.js:110 Ground [-0]
```

Probably due to the fact that we're connecting disconnected circuits to ground with a high-value resistor. Time to consider #27 more seriously?

issue.title: Add ground component
issue.body:
Should have a max length?

Every instance connected to node 0.
